item.description:
Come join us at the Coolidge for an evening of burlesque education and entertainment to benefit The Great Boston Burlesque Exposition (www.Burlesque-Expo.com).

First, Burlesque historian David Kruh (author of Always Something Doing: Boston's Infamous Scully Square) takes us on a tour of The Old Howard, Boston's most famous burlesque hall.

Next, we get to watch Barbara Stanwyk in the in a forgotten film noir gem Lady of Burlesque (1943). This movie is based on a novel by Gypsy Rose Lee, a real-life burlesquer and the inspiration for the musical Gypsy.

Lastly, after the movie, the Boston Babydolls Burlesque Troupe take the stage for an eye-popping, bumping, grinding, show!

Cost is $12. All proceeds benefit The Professional Burlesque Society, a non-profit educational organization that helps burlesque, sideshow, and vaudeville performers educate themselves not only about their performance skills, but also about the realities of doing business.

As always, we will be meeting after the film. Nicole, your friendly meetup assistant organizer, will be holding a Meetup sign at the front of the theater after the program ends.

P.S. If anyone has any suggestions for where to meet afterwards, please message Nicole. It needs to be near the Coolidge and open after 9 pm. Thanks!
